title: PandasRead JSON

metadata.description: Learn about PandasRead JSON with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Read JSON
Big data sets are often stored, or extracted as JSON.
JSON is plain text, but has the format of an object, and is well known in the world of programming, including Pandas.
In our examples we will be using a JSON file called 'data.json'.
Open data.json
.
Example
Load the JSON file into a DataFrame:
import pandas as pd
df = pd.read_json('data.json')
print(df.to_string())

Tip:
use
to_string()
to print the entire DataFrame.
Dictionary as JSON
JSON = Python Dictionary
JSON objects have the same format as Python dictionaries.
If your JSON code is not in a file, but in a Python Dictionary, you can load it into a DataFrame 
directly:
Example
Load a Python Dictionary into a DataFrame:
import pandas as pd
data = {
"Duration":{
"0":60,
"1":60,
"2":60,
"3":45,
"4":45,
"5":60
},
"Pulse":{
"0":110,
"1":117,
"2":103,
"3":109,
"4":117,
"5":102
},
"Maxpulse":{
"0":130,
"1":145,
"2":135,
"3":175,
"4":148,
"5":127
},
"Calories":{
"0":409,
"1":479,
"2":340,
"3":282,
"4":406,
"5":300
}
}
df = pd.DataFrame(data)
print(df)

★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
import pandas as pd
df = pd.read_json('data.json')
print(df.to_string())

summary: This tutorial covers PandasRead JSON concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PandasRead JSON effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PandasRead JSON and how to apply it in your projects.
